item.title: Spec Home Purchase Strategy: Buying Spec Homes vs Custom Builds with Construction Financing
item.description:
When most people think about buying new construction, they imagine designing every detail from the ground up—choosing floor plans, selecting finishes, and watching their dream home come to life over months of construction. But there’s another path to new construction ownership that’s faster, often less expensive, and requires simpler financing: buying a spec home.

Spec homes (short for “speculative” homes) are builder-constructed houses built without a specific buyer in mind—usually move-in ready or near completion when you start shopping. Understanding the differences between spec home purchases and custom builds helps you choose the right new construction approach based on your timeline, budget, customization priorities, and financing situation.

item.title: Construction-to-Permanent Loan Guide: Complete Process from Groundbreaking to Permanent Mortgage
item.description:
Building your dream home from the ground up is exciting—but the financing can feel overwhelming if you don’t understand how construction-to-permanent loans actually work. Unlike traditional mortgages where you borrow once and start making payments immediately, construction-to-permanent financing structures everything differently: one closing, extended rate locks, draw-based funding, interest-only payments during the build, and automatic conversion to a traditional mortgage when construction is complete.

If you’re considering new construction, understanding this loan type is essential before signing builder contracts or breaking ground. Here’s everything you need to know about construction-to-permanent loans—from qualification through final conversion.
